intro: Coccocypselum condalia var. caaguazuense, commonly known as the Caaguazú coccocypselum, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded areas within tropical rainforests. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
